file_content.text: The resistance are confiscating their own comm units to figure out what happened. So much for their communications.
We have little to say to each other.
There's been chatter on the resistance frequencies while you were off planting the ordnance.
Resistance grenades have been malfunctioning. Would you know anything about that?
Toybox had an idea to limit civilian casualties. I went with it.
We implemented a plan.
No.
Funny, because Toybox said something quite different when I asked him why he still had trapped comms on his table today.
He suggested the two of you disobeyed our battle plan and neglected to inform any Imperial units of the rather explosive changes.
It was a strategy to ensure military targets. I will take both the credit and the blame.
I came up with that.
Civilian casualties are intentional. Both civilian and resistance must fear the bombs, it's how we kill their morale.
But besides that point, when you countermand my orders, Imperial troops need to be notified of any change.
We now have to throw out every salvaged grenade in the mix because we don't know which ones are rigged to blow!
The resistance has to do the same, and they lost soldiers. You're still ahead.
It'll balance out.
That is one point in your favor, but a war of attrition was not what I had in mind.
Is that all?
Be grateful for your Sith rank. For his part in this, Toybox is going to the stockade to receive lashes.
Be grateful for Watcher Two's interest in you. For his part, Toybox will go to the stockade for a few days and receive lashes.
Be grateful you are not part of our rank structure. For his part, Toybox will spend a few days in the stockade and receive lashes.
You I cannot punish, but I would offer free advice. There are people on this planet who replace everyday items with explosives.
Do not push them beyond reason.
I overstepped my bounds. I apologize.
I failed you.
I suppose that will do. You're lucky you're not in our rank structure.
For his part in this, Toybox will spend a few days in the stockade and receive lashes.
You I cannot punish, but I doubt we will work together again.
The resistance has set off three bombs so far. The first blast sent them scattering.
Then, of course, they attempted to stay in touch via comm unit, so you can imagine the results. Quite a successful operation.
They defied the Empire. Now they will fear it again.
They deserved their fate.
I'll say. One bomb went off near the resistance's medical bay. They say they're treating wounded on conference room tables now.
No problem.
Well, it's delivered the punishment. One bomb went off near their medical bay. They'll have quite a time recovering.
Has there been any collateral damage?
What about civilians?
Positively. One of the comm units wasn't far from their medical bay, and we think some teenager had the second one.
Both are good. Without a medical bay, resistance wounded will suffer, and the boy will serve as a lesson for looters.
And with the investigation they'll have to launch to discover our method, we'll be ahead for quite some time.
If we get lucky, the resistance will take the units back to the barracks or an armory. Then... bang.
Welcome to the front, my lord. Your reputation precedes you.
Ah, the apprentice. I was wondering when you'd reach the front lines.
The bounty hunter. I've heard of you.
The Watchers said new agents were in the area. It's good you're here.
I'm Fixer 66. I'm with the operations branch of Imperial Intelligence, and if you have a moment, I'd like to show you something.
You have my attention, Fixer.
I'll listen.
Go.
I see you're monitoring communications. What more should I know?
Such as comm units?
On the left is an ordinary Republic comm unit issued to resistance fighters. You've probably seen hundreds before.
This other one is a Republic comm unit that has undergone some surgery. Please look, don't touch.
The second one contains a half-kilo of high explosive that detonates when the "talk" button is pressed.
I assume this is meant to deal with the resistance?
A trap for the enemy?
Yes.
Go on.
I can imagine the effects when it is held to one's ear.
I like it.
A cruel joke. Better still, an effective one.
I like it.
This is why I never let my holocom out of my sight.
Nice trick.
If you're leaving them next to each other like that, I recommend some kind of sticker.
Don't mix them up.
The plan is to take a few of these sabotaged comm units behind the resistance's lines and plant them on their dead.
The resistance should soon salvage the comms and take them back to their headquarters. The resulting explosions will cripple and panic them.
We'd prefer someone like you to take point. Someone who won't break if captured, and who can go without reinforcements. Can you do this?
The resistance will soon see death everywhere.
We will annihilate them.
Your instructors at the Korriban Academy must have loved you.
Well, if that's your business, you certainly came to the right planet.
Sign me up.
Head over to our technical man, a Balmorra local we drafted. The men call him "Toybox."
He'll give you the ordnance and show you how to transport it safely.
I have other priorities right now.
Not today. [Refuse quest]
Then I won't bother you more.
Shh. Monitoring radio traffic.
